intro: Tieghemopanax decorans, commonly known as the ornate sycamore, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter, giving it a distinctive and ornamental appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
